language.resource: Configures groups and applications in a new site
This group has not yet been set up. Sign in as an owner of this group to complete the setup.
This site has not yet been set up. Sign in as a site administrator to complete the setup.
To help get your new group set up, please provide the following information:
Select an image to represent this group throughout this site. A 600 by 600 pixel image, or larger, is recommended.
Select applications this group should support. Additional applications can be added later using the "New" menu
Show only the selected application(s) on the group home page
If you aren't planning on adding additional applications after this group is set up, enable this option to update the layout of the group to show only the application(s) you've selected.
To help get your new community set up, please provide the following information:
This name will be shown throughout the site to refer to the community.
Describe the purpose of this community.
Select an image to use in the header of the site. A 250 by 88 pixel image (or an image with a similar aspect ratio) is recommended.

List the products that you want to support in this community. Groups and applications will be created to support these products. Additional groups and applications can be added later using the "New" menu on a group.

Groups are used to organize content and functionality at a high level within the community. Identify your top-level groups and their applications below. Additional groups and applications can be added later using the "New" menu on a group or the Group Administration area of the Control Panel.
List your company's departments and select their applications. Additional departments and applications can be added later using the "New" menu within a group.
Are you sure you want to remove this product?
Are you sure you want to remove this group?
Are you sure you want to remove this department?
If you provide the email address of the user that will own this group, we'll invite them to own the group as part of this set up process.
If you provide the email address of the user that will own this department, we'll invite them to own the resulting group as part of this set up process.
Select an avatar to represent this department throughout this site. A 600 by 600 pixel image, or larger, is recommended.

Congratulations! Your new group, {0}, is now set up. Next, you may want to:

  • Publish some content
    Use the "new" menu in your group to publish content to your group.
  • Invite or add members
    If your group is membership-based, you may want to add or invite members.
An error occurred while setting up this group. Please try again.
Your new community is set up

Congratulations! Your new community is now set up. Next, you may want to:

  • Personalize your community
    Go to Manage Site Theme to customize headers, footers, pages, styling, and other theme options.
  • Customize email templates
    Go to Administration > Translation and review templated email messages to customize email coming from this community.
  • Publish content
    Use the "new" menu to publish content to your community.
An error occurred while setting up this community. Please try again.
The setup options you selected will exceed your licensed number of {0}. Adjust your selections or contact your administrator to upgrade the site's license.

IMPORTANT: This community is using the Free Edition license and has restrictions and limitations (learn more about the Free Edition license). If you have a commercial license, please install the license before continuing with the starter kit site setup.

IMPORTANT: This community is using the Free Edition license and has restrictions and limitations (learn more about the Free Edition license). If you have a commercial license, please install the license before continuing with the starter kit site setup.

scriptedContentFragment.name: ${resource:Leaderboard_Name}
scriptedContentFragment.contentScript:
#set($pageIndex = 0) #set($pageIndex = $core_v2_ui.GetCurrentPageIndex()) #set($pageSize = 10) #set($pageSize = $core_v2_widget.GetIntValue('pageSize', 10)) #set($viewType = $core_v2_widget.GetStringValue('viewType', 'full')) #set($showValue = $core_v2_widget.GetBoolValue('showValue', true)) #set($showCurrentUser = $core_v2_widget.GetBoolValue('showCurrentUser', true)) #set($selectedLeaderboard = $core_v2_widget.GetStringValue("selectedLeaderboard", "")) #set($leaderboardId = $core_v2_utility.ParseInt($selectedLeaderboard)) #if($leaderboardId > 0) #set($leaderboard = $core_v2_leaderboard.Get($leaderboardId)) #set($isCurrent = false) #else #set($leaderboard = $core_v2_leaderboard.Current) #set($isCurrent = true) #end #if($leaderboard && $leaderboard.Errors.Count == 0 && $leaderboard.IsEnabled) #set($leaders = $core_v2_leader.List($leaderboard.Id, "%{PageSize = $pageSize, PageIndex = $pageIndex}")) #if(!$core_v2_user.Accessing.IsSystemAccount && $core_v2_user.Accessing.EnableDisplayInMemberList && $showCurrentUser && $leaderboard.LastCalculatedDate && $pageIndex == 0 && $leaders.TotalCount > 0 && $core_v2_leaderboard.UserIsEligible($leaderboard.Id)) #set($currentUserInList = false) #foreach ($leader in $leaders) #if($leader.user.Id == $core_v2_user.Accessing.Id) #set($currentUserInList = true) #end #end #if(!$currentUserInList) #set($currentLeader = $core_v2_leader.Get($leaderboard.Id)) #if ($currentLeader && $currentLeader.LeaderboardId > 0) $leaders.Add($currentLeader) #end #end #end
  • #if($viewType == 'simple') $core_v2_widget.ExecuteFile('simple.vm') #else $core_v2_widget.ExecuteFile('full.vm') #if($leaders && $viewType == 'full') $core_v2_ui.Pager($leaders.PageIndex, $leaders.PageSize, $leaders.TotalCount) #end #end
#else $core_v2_widget.Hide() #end
